think this is what is messing up its animation. also it stays locked thewhole time is whats the problem. thats why it wont extend. i tried it on a no mods installed ksp and worked fine.

notice the 3 errors dont know where they coming from. if u want whole log i can send it to u.

Possible bug, I have several ground stations on kerbin with the Reflectron ss-5 and a matching station on Mun, the Mun station dish is targeting Kerbin, and the Kerbin ground stations are targeting the Mun, and the Mun ground station separately, but I have no connection? The Reflectron ss-5 says its for Munar communication, but does it not have the range to reach ground to ground? will it only work in orbit, am I doing something wrong? the stations all have plenty of power, and clear line of sight. i'd post pictures, but I don't know how.

I just double checked, if I have a satilite in orbit point a dish at the Mun, I get a connection, but the ground stations on Kerbin do nothing, no connection at all.

I just double checked, if I have a satilite in orbit point a dish at the Mun, I get a connection, but the ground stations on Kerbin do nothing, no connection at all.

Replied with a quite long and gibberish monologue. Your ground station does not have a Signal Processor and can not relay signals.

*snip*

Common error, not the cause. Re-enable all your mods till the problem re-occurs to pinpoint the problem.

Replied with a quite long and gibberish monologue. Your ground station does not have a Signal Processor and can not relay signals.

Common error, not the cause. Re-enable all your mods till the problem re-occurs to pinpoint the problem.

Wait, Signal processor? Do you mean my ground stations need a probe core to work like I meant them too, even though they are manned? If that's what it is, I'm going to feel so dumb.

Wait, Signal processor? Do you mean my ground stations need a probe core to work like I meant them too, even though they are manned? If that's what it is, I'm going to feel so dumb.

Yup. But I'll see if I can change it up so manned crew works as well... A mechjeb casing will work for you as they contain a probe core.

Yup. But I'll see if I can change it up so manned crew works as well... A mechjeb casing will work for you as they contain a probe core.

Massive FACEPALM

Yup. But I'll see if I can change it up so manned crew works as well... A mechjeb casing will work for you as they contain a probe core.

Especially considering, I changed the design at the last minute to not include Mechjeb on the groundstations, if I hadn't they would have worked.

Just FYI for everyone and this mod. If you have Engineering Redux for all pods mod, the module manager that comes with that mod conflicts with RemoteTech2. I have no clue why they conflict, I am no programmer.

Especially considering, I changed the design at the last minute to not include Mechjeb on the groundstations, if I hadn't they would have worked.

I put out 1.0.7. Use that and reload your affected vessels and it should work.

What version of Engineering Redux do you have? The one I have doesn't come with module manager.

If you want the latest Module Manager that works for 1.3, this mod has it. Its version 1.0.4992.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-21-1-athlonic-electronics-lcd-launch-countdown-audioonscreen/

Just FYI for everyone and this mod. If you have Engineering Redux for all pods mod, the module manager that comes with that mod conflicts with RemoteTech2. I have no clue why they conflict, I am no programmer.
ok fixed it there was a entry in my custom .cfg to add chatter to the attana for some reason. once removed it it worked fine.

Finally its out now for 0.22 Good work and thanks a lot!

Good decission to keep out the delay until there is an automated control. Too much difficult to control anything with only just 2 seconds delay. Not to talk about several minutes delay

Don't suppose there's an option for infinite range? IE only LoS to transmitters/recievers matter, and the reason to use larger antenna over the smaller variety is for the amount of data that can be pushed?

Edited November 3, 2013 by therealcrow999
I guess I have to remember to add my Communotron to action group and toggle on before transmitting science.

Your math is correct power5000, the distance between any two satellites would be around 6000km. You would need antennae of at least a range of just over 6000 km, unless of course range is calculated by some additive formula rather than just by the limiting range.
ok thank you I'm only in 10th grade and only in the starts of geometry so I wanted to get my math checked thank you and that is very sad since I think the longest range atenna is only 5Mm...

so my atenna wont work correct?

Yea, side 3 is 6006830 meters. You can check it using simple trigoniometrics:

cos(pi/6)*3467057*2=6006830.

So no, your antennas wouldn't reach that. Either use a lower orbit or use more satellites. You'll need at least:

Ceiling(2*pi/arccos(3.5e6/(2*3467057))) = 7 satellites evenly spaced in geosynch with that antenna. I suggest simply going lower, I tend to use an 1.5 hour orbit. 3 sats easily cover that.

If you want a geosynchronous 3 satellite configuration the required antenna range would be 2* (radius + height) * cos 30deg = 2* (2868km+600km) * 0.866 = approx 6Mm. Not enough for the strongest omnidirectional antenna of 5Mm.

However, four satellites or using dishes, would work.

Four satellites: sqrt(2*(2868km+600km)^2) = approx 4.9Mm

Edited November 3, 2013 by Cilph

Cilph, just to make sure I understand dishes clearly, if I were to launch a probe to Duna, I would both have to set the probe's dish to target one in orbit of Kerbin, and set one of the dishes on a satellite orbiting Kerbin to target the Duna probe before the probe got out of signal range?
Hmm... looking at the config files, would I just have to remove the Mode0/Mode1 lines or change them to an astronomically high number to get the "Only LoS Needed" effect I'm looking for?
